router-id.description: Use this attribute to configure PIM router-ID to uniquely identify the router.By default, PIM registers for the NSM router-id service. This attribute will override the router-id received from NSM.

join-prune-interval.description: Use this attribute to set a PIM join/prune timer.

enable-bfd-all-interfaces.description: Use this attribute to enable Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD) on all interfaces.

ecmp-bundle.description: Use this attribute to create an ECMP bundle.

dense-mode-group.description: Use this attribute to force a particular group to always follow dense mode irrespective of whether RP mapping is available or not in SM-DM mode.

config.description: Configuration data for PIM IPv4 register packet

register-reachability-check.description: Use this attribute to enable the RP reachability check for PIM Registers at the designated router (DR).

rate-limit.description: Use this attribute to configure the rate of register packets sent by this designated router (DR).

suppress-interval.description: Use this attribute to configure the register suppression time.

keep-alive-interval.description: Use this attribute to configure a Keep alive Timer (KAT) value for (S,G) states at RP to monitor PIM register packets.

source-address.description: Use this attribute to configure the source address of register packets sent by this designated router (DR).

accept-register.description: Use this attribute to configure the ACL of register packets accepted by this designated router (DR).

config.description: Configuration data for PIM IPv4 interoperability

ignore-rp-set-priority.description: Use this attribute to ignore the RP-SET priority value, and use only the hashing mechanism for RP selection. This is used to inter-operate with older Cisco IOS versions.

cisco-bsr-interop-enable.description: Use this attribute to turn on or turn the Candidate-RP debugging timerworking with Cisco BSR.

config.description: Configuration data for PIM IPv4 register interoperability

cisco-register-checksum-enable.description: Use this attribute to configure the option to calculate the register checksum over the whole packet. This is used to inter-operate with older Cisco IOS versions.

access-control-list.description: Use this attribute to configure the option to calculate the register checksum over the whole packet on multicast groups specified by the access control list.

config.description: Configuration data for PIM IPv4 SSM

range-policy.description: Use this attribute to set Source Specific Multicast (SSM) and define the range of multicast IP addresses. Ranges can be either the default, which defines the SSM range as 232/8, or indicated by the given standard access control list.

expire-time.description: Especifies the time until entry timeout.

stopped.description: Especifies the entry timer is not running. When there is no expire-time.

peers.description: Container for PIM IPv4 MSDP peer

peer.description: List of PIM IPv4 MSDP peer

address.description: Use this attribute to configure an Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) peer relationship.

config.description: Configuration data for PIM IPv4 MSDP peer

address.description: Use this attribute to configure an Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) peer relationship.

source-address.description: Use this attribute to configure an Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) peer relationship.

mesh-group.description: Use this attribute to add a Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) peer to a mesh group.You can set up multiple mesh groups on the same device and multiple peers per mesh group.

default-peer.description: Use this attribute to set a Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) peer from which to accept Source-Active (SA) messages.You can have multiple active default peers: 1. When you enter multiple ip msdp default-peer commands with a prefix-list keyword, all the default peers are used at the same time for different RP prefixes. This form is typically used in a service provider cloud that connects stub site clouds. 2. When you enter multiple ip msdp default-peer commands without a prefix-list keyword, a single active peer accepts all SA messages. If that peer fails, the next configured default peer accepts all SA messages. This form is typically used at a stub site.

prefix-list.description: Use this attribute to set a Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) peer from which to accept Source-Active (SA) messages.You can have multiple active default peers: 1. When you enter multiple ip msdp default-peer commands with a prefix-list keyword, all the default peers are used at the same time for different RP prefixes. This form is typically used in a service provider cloud that connects stub site clouds. 2. When you enter multiple ip msdp default-peer commands without a prefix-list keyword, a single active peer accepts all SA messages. If that peer fails, the next configured default peer accepts all SA messages. This form is typically used at a stub site.

state.description: Operational state data for PIM IPv4 MSDP peer

counters.description: Operational state data for PIM IPv4 MSDP peer counters

keepalives-sent.description: This counter represents the Keepalive messages sent to peer.

keepalives-received.description: This counter represents the Keepalive messages received from the peer.

connection-retries.description: This counter represents the number of connect retries.

address.description: Use this attribute to configure an Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) peer relationship.

source-address.description: Use this attribute to configure an Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) peer relationship.

mesh-group.description: Use this attribute to add a Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) peer to a mesh group.You can set up multiple mesh groups on the same device and multiple peers per mesh group.

default-peer.description: Use this attribute to set a Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) peer from which to accept Source-Active (SA) messages.You can have multiple active default peers: 1. When you enter multiple ip msdp default-peer commands with a prefix-list keyword, all the default peers are used at the same time for different RP prefixes. This form is typically used in a service provider cloud that connects stub site clouds. 2. When you enter multiple ip msdp default-peer commands without a prefix-list keyword, a single active peer accepts all SA messages. If that peer fails, the next configured default peer accepts all SA messages. This form is typically used at a stub site.

prefix-list.description: Use this attribute to set a Multicast Source Discovery Protocol (MSDP) peer from which to accept Source-Active (SA) messages.You can have multiple active default peers: 1. When you enter multiple ip msdp default-peer commands with a prefix-list keyword, all the default peers are used at the same time for different RP prefixes. This form is typically used in a service provider cloud that connects stub site clouds. 2. When you enter multiple ip msdp default-peer commands without a prefix-list keyword, a single active peer accepts all SA messages. If that peer fails, the next configured default peer accepts all SA messages. This form is typically used at a stub site.

sg-rpt-entries.description: The RPT is the path between the RP and receivers (hosts) in a multicast group. The RPT is built by means of a PIM join message from a receiver's DR. This attribute returnes the PIM RPT include entries.

name.description: The interface name to configure PIM IPv4 parameters.

pim-mode.description: PIM IPv4 mode to use when delivering multicast traffic via this interface.

bsr-border.description: When set to true the device will not send bootstrap router messages over this interface. By default these are transmitted over all PIM IPv4 sparse mode (PIM-SM) enabled interfaces.

dr-priority.description: The designated router priority of this interface. Larger always preferred.

hello-interval.description: Use this attribute to configure a hello interval value other than the default. When a hello-interval is configured and hello-holdtime is not configured, or when the hello-holdtime value configured is less than the new hello-interval value, the holdtime value is modified to (3.5 * hello_interval). Otherwise, the hello-holdtime value is the configured value.

hello-holdtime.description: Use this attribute to configure a hello message holdtime other than the default.

exclude-generated-id.description: Exclude Gen-id option from PIM IPv4 Hello packets on this interface.

unicast-bootstrap-router.description: Use this attribute to enable support for sending and receiving unicast Bootstrap Messages (BSM) on an interface.

neighbor-access-control-list-filter.description: Use this attribute to enable filtering of neighbors on the interface. When configuring a neighbor filter, PIM IPv4 either not establishes adjacency with neighbor or terminates adjacency with existing neighbors, when denied by filtering access list.

state-refresh-origination-interval.description: Use this attribute to configure a PIM-DM State-Refresh origination interval other than the default value. The origination interval is the number of seconds between PIM-DM State Refresh control messages.

ecmp-bundle.description: Use this attribute to configure an ECMP bundle.

enable-bfd.description: Use this attribute to configure Bidirectional Forwarding Detection.

state.description: Operational state data for PIM IPv4 interfaces

pim-mode.description: PIM IPv4 mode to use when delivering multicast traffic via this interface.

bsr-border.description: When set to true the device will not send bootstrap router messages over this interface. By default these are transmitted over all PIM IPv4 sparse mode (PIM-SM) enabled interfaces.

dr-priority.description: The designated router priority of this interface. Larger always preferred.

hello-interval.description: Use this attribute to configure a hello interval value other than the default. When a hello-interval is configured and hello-holdtime is not configured, or when the hello-holdtime value configured is less than the new hello-interval value, the holdtime value is modified to (3.5 * hello_interval). Otherwise, the hello-holdtime value is the configured value.

hello-holdtime.description: Use this attribute to configure a hello message holdtime other than the default.

exclude-generated-id.description: Exclude Gen-id option from PIM IPv4 Hello packets on this interface.

unicast-bootstrap-router.description: Use this attribute to enable support for sending and receiving unicast Bootstrap Messages (BSM) on an interface.

neighbor-access-control-list-filter.description: Use this attribute to enable filtering of neighbors on the interface. When configuring a neighbor filter, PIM IPv4 either not establishes adjacency with neighbor or terminates adjacency with existing neighbors, when denied by filtering access list.

state-refresh-origination-interval.description: Use this attribute to configure a PIM-DM State-Refresh origination interval other than the default value. The origination interval is the number of seconds between PIM-DM State Refresh control messages.

ecmp-bundle.description: Use this attribute to configure an ECMP bundle.

enable-bfd.description: Use this attribute to configure Bidirectional Forwarding Detection.

next-hello.description: Time for the next hello message.

router-id.description: PIM IPv4 router-ID that uniquely identifies the router.

bidir.description: Configuration data for PIM IPv4 Interface BIDIR

neighbor-access-control-list-filter.description: >Use this attribute to configure an access list (ACL) to specify the bidirectionally capable neighbors that participate in the designated forwarder (DF) election.

neighbor-access-control-list-filter.description: >Use this attribute to configure an access list (ACL) to specify the bidirectionally capable neighbors that participate in the designated forwarder (DF) election.

designated-forwarder.description: List of PIM IPv4 Interface BIDIR designated-forwarder

df-state.description: This attribute returns the PIM designated forwarder election, protocol state.

df-address.description: This attribute returns the PIM designated forwarder IP address.

metric-preference.description: This attribute returns the PIM last winner metric preference.

offer-count.description: This attribute returns the PIM offer count.

neighbor.description: List of PIM IPv4 interface neighbor

neighbor-established.description: This timestamp indicates the time that the PIM IPv4 neighbor adjacency established.

neighbor-expires.description: This timestamp indicates the time that the PIM IPv4 neighbor adjacency will expire should hello messages fail to arrive from the neighbor.

dr-priority.description: Use this attribute to set the Designated Router's priority value.

generated-id.description: PIM IPv4 router-ID that uniquely identifies the neighbor generated ID.

router-id.description: PIM IPv4 router-ID that uniquely identifies the neighbor router ID.

secondary-address.description: The secondary addresses advertised by the PIM IPv4 neighbor.

vrf-name.description: VRF name associated with this instance.

router-id.description: Use this attribute to configure PIM router-ID to uniquely identify the router.By default, PIM registers for the NSM router-id service. This attribute will override the router-id received from NSM.

join-prune-interval.description: Use this attribute to set a PIM join/prune timer.

enable-bfd-all-interfaces.description: Use this attribute to enable Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD) on all interfaces.

ecmp-bundle.description: Use this attribute to create an ECMP bundle.

dense-mode-group.description: Use this attribute to force a particular group to always follow dense mode irrespective of whether RP mapping is available or not in SM-DM mode.

register-packet.description: Container for PIM IPv6 register packet

config.description: Configuration data for PIM IPv6 register packet

register-reachability-check.description: Use this attribute to enable the RP reachability check for PIM Registers at the designated router (DR).

rate-limit.description: Use this attribute to configure the rate of register packets sent by this designated router (DR).

suppress-interval.description: Use this attribute to configure the register suppression time.

keep-alive-interval.description: Use this attribute to configure a Keep alive Timer (KAT) value for (S,G) states at RP to monitor PIM register packets.

source-address.description: Use this attribute to configure the source address of register packets sent by this designated router (DR).

accept-register.description: Use this attribute to configure the ACL of register packets accepted by this designated router (DR).

config.description: Configuration data for PIM IPv6 interoperability

ignore-rp-set-priority.description: Use this attribute to ignore the RP-SET priority value, and use only the hashing mechanism for RP selection. This is used to inter-operate with older Cisco IOS versions.

cisco-bsr-interop-enable.description: Use this attribute to turn on or turn the Candidate-RP debugging timerworking with Cisco BSR.

cisco-register-checksum-enable.description: Use this attribute to configure the option to calculate the register checksum over the whole packet. This is used to inter-operate with older Cisco IOS versions.

access-control-list.description: Use this attribute to configure the option to calculate the register checksum over the whole packet on multicast groups specified by the access control list.

range-policy.description: Use this attribute to set Source Specific Multicast (SSM) and define the range of multicast IP addresses. Ranges can be either the default, which defines the SSM range as FF3x::/96, or indicated by the given standard access control list.

sg-rpt-entries.description: The RPT is the path between the RP and receivers (hosts) in a multicast group. The RPT is built by means of a PIM join message from a receiver's DR. This attribute returnes the PIM RPT include entries.

name.description: The interface name to configure PIM IPv6 parameters.

config.description: Configuration data for PIM IPv6 interfaces

name.description: The interface name to configure PIM IPv6 parameters.

pim-mode.description: PIM IPv6 mode to use when delivering multicast traffic via this interface.

bsr-border.description: When set to true the device will not send bootstrap router messages over this interface. By default these are transmitted over all PIM IPv6 sparse mode (PIM-SM) enabled interfaces.

dr-priority.description: The designated router priority of this interface. Larger always preferred.

hello-interval.description: Use this attribute to configure a hello interval value other than the default. When a hello-interval is configured and hello-holdtime is not configured, or when the hello-holdtime value configured is less than the new hello-interval value, the holdtime value is modified to (3.5 * hello_interval). Otherwise, the hello-holdtime value is the configured value.

hello-holdtime.description: Use this attribute to configure a hello message holdtime other than the default.

exclude-generated-id.description: Exclude Gen-id option from PIM IPv6 Hello packets on this interface.

unicast-bootstrap-router.description: Use this attribute to enable support for sending and receiving unicast Bootstrap Messages (BSM) on an interface.

neighbor-access-control-list-filter.description: Use this attribute to enable filtering of neighbors on the interface. When configuring a neighbor filter, PIM IPv6 either not establishes adjacency with neighbor or terminates adjacency with existing neighbors, when denied by filtering access list.

state-refresh-origination-interval.description: Use this attribute to configure a PIM-DM State-Refresh origination interval other than the default value. The origination interval is the number of seconds between PIM-DM State Refresh control messages.

ecmp-bundle.description: Use this attribute to configure an ECMP bundle.

enable-bfd.description: Use this attribute to configure Bidirectional Forwarding Detection.

state.description: Operational state data for PIM IPv6 interfaces

name.description: The interface name to configure PIM IPv6 parameters.

pim-mode.description: PIM IPv6 mode to use when delivering multicast traffic via this interface.

bsr-border.description: When set to true the device will not send bootstrap router messages over this interface. By default these are transmitted over all PIM IPv6 sparse mode (PIM-SM) enabled interfaces.

dr-priority.description: The designated router priority of this interface. Larger always preferred.

hello-interval.description: Use this attribute to configure a hello interval value other than the default. When a hello-interval is configured and hello-holdtime is not configured, or when the hello-holdtime value configured is less than the new hello-interval value, the holdtime value is modified to (3.5 * hello_interval). Otherwise, the hello-holdtime value is the configured value.

hello-holdtime.description: Use this attribute to configure a hello message holdtime other than the default.

exclude-generated-id.description: Exclude Gen-id option from PIM IPv6 Hello packets on this interface.

unicast-bootstrap-router.description: Use this attribute to enable support for sending and receiving unicast Bootstrap Messages (BSM) on an interface.

neighbor-access-control-list-filter.description: Use this attribute to enable filtering of neighbors on the interface. When configuring a neighbor filter, PIM IPv6 either not establishes adjacency with neighbor or terminates adjacency with existing neighbors, when denied by filtering access list.

state-refresh-origination-interval.description: Use this attribute to configure a PIM-DM State-Refresh origination interval other than the default value. The origination interval is the number of seconds between PIM-DM State Refresh control messages.

ecmp-bundle.description: Use this attribute to configure an ECMP bundle.

enable-bfd.description: Use this attribute to configure Bidirectional Forwarding Detection.

next-hello.description: Time for the next hello message.

router-id.description: PIM IPv4 router-ID that uniquely identifies the router.

neighbors.description: State data for PIM IPv6 interface neighbors

neighbor.description: List of PIM IPv6 interface neighbor

state.description: Operational state data for PIM IPv6 interface neighbors

neighbor-established.description: This timestamp indicates the time that the PIM IPv6 neighbor adjacency established.

neighbor-expires.description: This timestamp indicates the time that the PIM IPv6 neighbor adjacency will expire should hello messages fail to arrive from the neighbor.

dr-priority.description: Use this attribute to set the Designated Router's priority value.

generated-id.description: PIM IPv6 router-ID that uniquely identifies the neighbor generated ID.

router-id.description: PIM IPv4 router-ID that uniquely identifies the neighbor router ID.

secondary-address.description: The secondary addresses advertised by the PIM IPv6 neighbor.
